name: Unity Productions Foundation
mission: UPF seeks to counter in society is the prevalence of bigotry and stereotypical depictions of Muslims in film and television and the effect these media caricatures have on social relations in America.
programs: The Great American Muslim Road Trip
UPF Film - The Sultan and the Saint
UPF Film - American Muslims: Facts vs. Fiction
theoryOfChange: Unity Productions Foundation (UPF) has a published approach to creating change, articulated in their YouTube video 'Unity Productions Foundation – Help Change the Narrative'. The video describes UPF as a nonprofit media company committed to dismantling stereotypes and cultivating authentic understanding across cultural and religious boundaries. They achieve this by harnessing the power of media to ignite empathy, spark critical conversations, and build enduring bridges between communities through cinematic storytelling and far-reaching outreach campaigns.

components.evidence: Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: ibn_sabil (+5)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 27/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses
components.name: Financial Health

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Unity Productions Foundation earns 66/100 due to strong impact and moderate alignment (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: No explicit mention of 'zakat' acceptance, dedicated zakat funds, or zakat-eligible recipients on Unity Productions Foundation's website or in the provided search results. The organization's mission is to counter bigotry and create peace through media, focusing on religious and cultural pluralism.

all_citations.claim: UPF holds a Charity Navigator score of 97.5/100 and maintains strong financial accountability.
The organization reported total revenue of $2,774,622.
UPF conducts teacher workshops and produces discussion guides for its films to counter stereotypes.
Audited financials confirm the organization's asset base and program spending.
UPF programs reach global viewers to foster cultural understanding.
The organization utilizes educational workshops as a core metric for program outcomes.
Financial data confirms a program expense ratio of 76.1% and fundraising efficiency of $0.22 per $1 raised.
The organization accepts general donations and Sadaqah to support its media mission.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a GMG score of 66/100, reflecting high marks for financial transparency and organizational health, balanced by a medium alignment score for traditional religious donors. Its focus on capacity building through media provides a unique but specialized impact profile.
areas_for_improvement: Moderate alignment for specific donor groups due to its focus on cultural and media-based advocacy
program expense ratio of 76.1% leaves room for further optimization toward direct programming

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization is classified as Sadaqah-eligible, offering a medium donor fit for those prioritizing cultural advocacy and media representation [8]. While the cause urgency is high within the religious and cultural sector, the alignment score of 27/50 reflects its specialized niche in film and television rather than direct humanitarian aid [1][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: UPF demonstrates high impact through capacity building, reaching global viewers and conducting teacher workshops to integrate its content into educational settings [3][5][6]. With a total revenue of $2,774,622 and a program expense ratio of 76.1%, the organization maintains a high data confidence level of 0.95 regarding its financial health and operational transparency [1][2][7].

baseline_narrative.headline: Unity Productions Foundation utilizes media and film to counter bigotry and stereotypical depictions of Muslims in American society.
strengths: High financial accountability with a Charity Navigator score of 97.5/100
Strong liquidity with 13.1 months of working capital
Efficient fundraising operations spending only $0.22 per $1 raised
baseline_narrative.summary: Unity Productions Foundation (UPF) is a media-focused nonprofit that produces educational films and television content to improve social relations and challenge caricatures of the Muslim community [1][3]. The organization operates several key initiatives, including Muslims on Screen and Television (MOST) and The Great American Muslim Road Trip, to foster cultural understanding [3][5].

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization has experienced a <cite id="14">3-year revenue CAGR of -36.7%</cite>, indicating a significant downward trend in annual funding.
Charity Navigator reports that <cite id="15">60% of board members are independent</cite>, which is lower than the 75% threshold often recommended for non-profit governance.

bbb_assessment.summary: Maintains high accountability standards with audited financial statements and clear governance policies.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains <cite id="8">over 13.1 months of working capital</cite>, providing a substantial buffer against short-term funding gaps.
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="14">36.7% decline in revenue</cite> over the last three years, which may impact future program scaling.

confidence.data_freshness: Financial data current through 2023 tax year
data_gaps: Detailed explanation for recent revenue decline
confidence.notes: Strong data availability across financial and program dimensions.

alignment.explanation: The organization is a strong fit for donors interested in <cite id="4">media advocacy and cultural dialogue</cite>, though it is <cite id="17">Sadaqah-eligible only</cite>.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust UPF due to its <cite id="13">Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and its <cite id="15">long-standing history since 1999</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To further strengthen credibility, the organization could increase its <cite id="15">percentage of independent board members</cite> to meet higher governance benchmarks.

impact.improvement: Impact measurement could be enhanced by publishing more recent <cite id="7">outcome data from teacher workshops</cite> and community dialogue sessions.

rich_narrative.headline: Unity Productions Foundation utilizes media and film to counter bigotry and stereotypical depictions of Muslims in American society.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who believe in the power of media to shape public perception and want to support high-quality storytelling that counters Islamophobia.
donor_motivations: Want to support accurate Muslim representation in Hollywood
Value cultural dialogue and educational outreach
Prefer supporting established organizations with a 25-year track record
Interested in media-based advocacy rather than direct social services
giving_considerations: The organization is currently navigating a period of revenue contraction
Impact is measured through reach and cultural influence rather than individual service metrics
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill Zakat obligations or those who prioritize immediate humanitarian relief (food, water, medicine).

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade B reflects <cite id="6">verified reach metrics</cite> and a documented theory of change, though third-party longitudinal studies are not publicly available.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: UPF creates impact by producing high-quality films that are then used in <cite id="5">community dialogues</cite> and <cite id="7">educational workshops</cite> to change hearts and minds.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that media production translates into actual shifts in social relations and educational understanding.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Despite a <cite id="14">revenue decline</cite>, the organization has a high funding gap and significant potential to scale its <cite id="4">educational outreach</cite>.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="11">Emmy® Award-nominated content</cite> and direct engagement with Hollywood through the MOST project.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on arts and culture with a grantmaking model

similar_organizations.differentiator: Larger scale media organization with a broader investigative focus

strengths.detail: The organization holds an <cite id="9">overall score of 97.97.5/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting high standards of transparency and governance.
UPF demonstrates lean operations, spending only <cite id="10">$0.22 per $1 raised</cite> in its fundraising efforts.
With <cite id="8">13.1 months of working capital</cite> in working capital, the charity is well-positioned for long-term sustainability.

strengths_deep_dive: Unity Productions Foundation distinguishes itself through its niche focus on media as a tool for social change. Their <cite id="4">MOST Resource Center</cite> acts as a bridge between the Muslim community and the entertainment industry, ensuring more nuanced portrayals in film and television. This impact is amplified by their <cite id="11">Emmy® Award nomination for The Sultan and The Saint</cite>, which validates the high production quality and cultural relevance of their work. Financially, the organization is robust, with <cite id="12">total assets of $4,036,345</cite> and a <cite id="13">Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Unity Productions Foundation (UPF) is a media-focused nonprofit that produces educational films and television content to improve social relations and challenge caricatures of the Muslim community. Founded in <cite id="1">1999</cite>, UPF utilizes high-quality media to counter bigotry and stereotypical depictions of Muslims in American society. The organization reported <cite id="2">$2,774,622 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year, with a <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 76.1%</cite>. UPF operates several key initiatives, including the <cite id="4">Muslims on Screen and Television (MOST) Resource Center</cite>, which provides accurate information to Hollywood writers and producers, and the <cite id="5">20,000 Dialogues</cite> program, which facilitates community discussions around its films. Their work has achieved significant reach, with documentation indicating <cite id="6">global viewers reached totaling 150,000,000</cite> through various broadcast and educational platforms. The organization has also conducted <cite id="7">25 teacher workshops</cite> to integrate its materials into educational curricula. UPF maintains strong financial health, evidenced by <cite id="8">13.1 months of working capital</cite> and an <cite id="9">overall score of 97.97.5/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>.
